item.title: A better way to accept Pandas DataFrames as function arguments
item.description: A better way to accept Pandas DataFrames as function arguments Much of the modelling code was already written when I joined the project. I spent a few days reading through the spaghetti that was this Python model and I noticed a recurring pattern. It looks something like this: def calculate_kpi( df: pd.DataFrame, df_weights: pd.DataFrame, country: str ) -> pd.DataFrame: df["sales_volumes"] = sales_volumes(df, df_weights, country) return df.groupby(["profit", "weight"]).mean() At this point in time you’re either nodding your head knowingly (you poor thing), or you’re a little confused (I was), or you think that the code you just read looks perfectly reasonable (lol).
